data.name: Talk Like Yoda, You Will
data.description:
You are on a team which must create a robotic version of yoda for a convention. The robot will use text to speech, and you are tasked with creating a function which, when given a basic english sentence (in the order subject, verb, object), will return a yoda-like sentence (in the order object, subject, verb).

```
Examples:
"You have much to learn" >> "Much to learn, you have"
"You must follow me" >> "Follow me, you must"
```

If you are not good at English, as I am (even as a native speaker). You might find it helpful to review the structure of sentences in the link below.

(https://academicguides.waldenu.edu/writingcenter/grammar/sentencestructure)

Keep in mind that this website mentions prepositional phrases, which for the purpose of this, can be said to be included in the object.
```"Spaghetti for dinner, I like"```



**What It Will Do**

* Return a yoda-orded *simple* english sentence

The only subjects (of the sentence) that will be used are as follows:
```subjects = ["i", "you", "he", "she", "they", "yoda", "luke"]```

NOTE words such as "me" or "them" MAY be present in the sentence, but will NOT be used as the subject
Such as in the example :
      "You must follow **me**" >> "Follow **me**, you must"

The only verbs present are as follows:
```verbs = ["have", "must", "are", "is", 'will', 'needs', 'need']```

**The verbs and subjects will be preloaded in the kata
**They are lists, named as they appear above; You DO NOT have to type them yourself

* Place a comma following the object of the sentence

Such as in the example :
      "You must follow me" >> "Follow me **,** you must"


**What It Wont Do**

* Work with sentence structures other than a simple sentence

* Use verbs / subjects other than what is provided


**I appreciate any feedback that you may provide in the discussion, have fun!!**
